Each time you log into the game you will see a list of updates that were made since the last time you logged in. You will only see each message once. "Sep 26 02:22 StoryCoder Azrael, \\"Rooms used to deduct from daily pay back when the pay went direct to the PC. Now that the pay goes to the guild, and from there to the PC depending on how much the guild pays... it's less meaningful. It deducts from the pool that the guild gets, so the individual probably still gets the same amount. I should update the rooms so they take money direct from the PCs bank account each \\"day\\" that they get daily income. In fact, should remove daily income control from the guild altogether.\\""

"Nov 19 03:00 StoryPlotter Ditto, \\"They aren't broken persay. Az changed the way merchants work. The problems with the merchants is in the stuff they sell. The merchant system targets items by their snames so if something has the same sname there is no way to target specific items. Example dyer merchant doesn't work because all dye sname is dye, the color isn't in the sname. Stuff now -must- have specific sname's and adjectives so that the merchant system can target them.\\""

"Apr 12 01:04 StoryCoder Azrael, \\"Okie dokie, the new concierge now allows PCs to return rooms as well. Once they have a room, it'll give them an option to return it. If they return a room in the gilded balance, it'll return their paid room and give them the free closet 1. If they return closet 1, it'll tell them that it's already free, and no need to return it.\\""

"Sep 4 07:47 StoryGoddess Eos, \\"It's been more than 10 months since we had our last round of promotions. I know the @event system didn't work well and people complained about it and we were to come up with other ways. But we really need to get it going again. We could for now tie guild-leader/house recommendations in with the @event points earned. To give players a chance to really influence it, but at the same time have it be proactive characters earn it. We can also just do a call for people to submit who they think deserves a promotion and why, outlining at least three good reasons, and we evaluate each of the recommendations as a temp fix right now until we can agree / create the system we want. It's not fair to punish players by not letting them earn promotions because we can't make up our mind or pull out our fingers!\\""

"May 23 08:21 StoryGoddess Eos, \\"\> 08:18 [TAS] \\"\<#37883/Eos\> closed by Eos: \> Page added to Cross's pending pages: \\"[May 23 08:18] Hey there. In regards to Jalal, what personal relationship are you referring to, or is it the general Rinaldi relationship to Jalal you're thinking of? Cheers.\\""

"May 23 09:01 StoryGoddess Eos, \\"Just to get all on the same page. Jalal bin Tawfiq is -one- trader/merchant in Akoma which is a continent comparable to Africa, so a huge area. In general, Sailors can import things from Akoma via the auction house, as they're dealing with all the pirates and stuff around the world. As for Jalal, there has in the past been several plots and stories involving him, starting with Anelie of the Doloreaux dressing up Chesh, Althea and others to look like Bisclavret. They sailed to Akoma to meet with Jalal and tried to disrupt trade to Triskellian and so on. A larger plot came of that and the Rinaldi sailed there several times. A year or two ago Jalal was in Triskellian, and he has some ties to the Rinaldi embassy as a whole. Ravenna spent several months at Jalal's place as a \\"guest\\" (hostage to guarantee Rinaldi promises) when the Rin bargained with Jalal to make him stop trading with the Jadelanders, while those back in Triskellian made sure Jalal got gunpowder and cannons (cannons provided by the Bisc, gunpowder by the Rinaldi - the Dolo were all paranoid about Jalal getting things like that). Tied into that there were some issues with the Sailors, as (one of Artemis' characters I can't recall the name of right now) had promised to go to Jalal's to teach them how to use guns and stuff, and when the time came for her to go, she was in the Sailors and the Sailors got all upset about it. So in short, Jalal is an Akoma VP, whom the Rinaldi has some ties to, but who can be contacted by anyone. He is a merchant, but he's far from the only merchant in Akoma. Jalal can be visited for plots (and has been several times, latest was when Virendra went to jungle Akoma to get slaves), and he can be invited to the city. This doesn't mean he provides any direct imports or anything, it's solely per plot basis. The auction house imports from Akoma is still and has always been the Sailors due to their general connections to Akoma and people trading with Akoma. I hope this is clear, otherwise feel free to poke me and I'll try to explain things better. Cheers.\\""

"Feb 25 16:47 StoryBuilder Cosmo, \\"VIA SKOTOS GOD UPDATE IN THE FORUMS ---- (Anything we did Friday needs to be checked, yo) ----CO-LO STABILITY PROBLEMS -------- Unfortunately, our co-lo had some stability problems Friday morning. ----- First up, they lost all of their connectivity to the facility that holds all of our games. This took them about 40 minutes to diagnose and a bit longer to restore. ------ Much more astonishingly, they rebooted all of their machines (which means all of our machines) while they were fixing the problem, with no notice. This probably had minimal repercussions on the SkotOS games (Marrach, Ironclaw, Lazarus, and Lovecraft). There may have been a rollback of an hour or two. ------------- TEC and Grendel's Revenge are more troublesome. TEC will suffer a rollback of 10 hours, to midnight (PT) last night, since the unannounced reboot happened one hour before the next backups. GR suffered a more complete failure. We're being forced to restore the entire machine from its backups, then we'll need to restore the game from the backups stored within that backup. The lineup of dates look promising (which is how we laid them out, 'lo these many years ago), so the hope is that we'll only suffer a 7 hour rollback, to the 3am (PT) game backup, but it's a bit dicey at the moment. ------ Apologies for the inconvenience; we're now making sure everything is stable, and we're looking into whether our most recent upgrades to TEC will support increasing the backups to every 6 hours. ------- Edit: The GR problem is proving even more intractable than hoped. As best I can tell, our colo is still having some issues because I can't boot the first restore I made of GR and I can't build a new node either. I expect this will just clear when they get their act together, but in the meantime I'm not able to get GR back online until they fix these problems.\\""

"Apr 28 17:40 StoryPlotter Spot, \\"So here is the pickpocket bug that Kenya and possibly Caelith has been using (amongst others). "Jan 17 04:38 StoryHost Azrael, \\"Ok, some experimental new trading code is in the black market merchant. If you ask him for exotic grain, he'll offer it to you, but the price will vary based on your skills. The more \\"shady\\" careers you have, and the better you speak dusky, the cheaper he'll sell it. If you don't have any skills that he's looking for, he'll pretend that he doesn't sell it at all. For Azrael, he's offering it for 43.2 denarii, but he'll go as low as 6 denarii for people with the right careers \& language. This should mean criminals can make some money dealing grains, without us having to make them inaccessable to others. (skilled PCs can sell them to others cheaper than the merchant will sell them for.) He'll also charge MORE for people with certain skills (constables, higher ranked people, etc.) - if this works out well, we can do other interesting things with the sort of code. Mostly I see it as a convenient way to get \\"props\\" out to the right PCs. (e.g. make pirate hooks cheaper for people with pirate skills, make crutches and splints cheaper for people with healing skills, and so on)\\""

"Jul 5 06:47 StoryHost Azrael, \\"New token types are being recorded, along with the career name that was used to generate them (so it'll record martial:sniper or martial:soldier etc. etc.) - it randomly picks which career to use, and if there isn't enough points in that career, it does what it can, then picks another career. (so if Faile has sniper 4 and soldier 16, it wants to give 10 martial tokens. It chooses randomly between the two careers, picks sniper, gives 4 martial:sniper tokens, then looks at the remaining martial careers, picks soldier, and gives the remaining 6 martial:soldier tokens. So with a low sniper career Faile can generate a few martial:sniper tokens, but not as many. If sniper was at level 10 or above, on average she'd generate the same number of sniper as soldier tokens.) - right now you can see the token sub-types in the guild pages, but I'll probably hide that at some point in the future.\\""

"Jan 14 02:07 StoryHost Azrael, \\"'+opage ian 'Ok, I did some digging about the Doloreaux (I knew I wasn't crazy when saying that they'd converted)... let me first point you to what I dug up, and then discuss how we should probably handle Lutarism in the city. Of course, page or email me to chat about this... Anyway... check out this forum thread: http://forum.skotos.net/showthread.php?t=52274 - have a look almost halfway down for the heading \\"A Brief History\\" - it talks about how the Rinaldi converted to S'allumer on the day of Helloise's death. \\"They were soon to be followed by the Bisclavret and the Avoirdupois royal houses. The Doloreaux royals accepted the radiance only recently.\\" - one of the four Archdukes of S'allumer is assigned to the Doloreaux as well. So, yeah, that was posted back in '06, it's not new information. Right beneath it, however, is a section titled \\"A Wise and Generious Doloreaux\\" which gives the other side of the story. It's a short story about someone who visits a Doloreaux noble and discovers \\"certain references to a series of holiday festivals still practiced in the heart of the Doloreaux homelands\\" then \\"as I leafed through its yellowed pages, the realization dawned that this could only be an account detailing the practice of the Doloreaux's secretive religion\\". It takes him a day to muster the courage to ask about the current practices of the Old Faith. So it's a big deal to even talk about Lutarism (since Lutarism is a heresy according to the Church of S'allumer). - I think what we can read from this, and also knowing the Doloreaux stubborn natures, is that they needed to accept S'allumer so they could \\"get by\\" with the other houses, benefit from trade in Triskellian etc. but they are stubborn enough to keep worshipping their old religion in secret. Even without any pressure from the S'allumer crowd Lutarism is a very secretive religion, and wouldn't normally be spoken about openly. It is probably a reasonable guess that Archduke Tremaine (leader of the Doloreaux) is still a Lutarist - although it would be a dangerous move to claim that out loud. There are other references to the church trying to raise money to build more S'allumer churches in Doloreaux land, and that being blocked by the Lutarists, and many S'allumer priests or missionaries in the north have gone missing - so they are certainly still a formidable force up north (even if not openly acknowledged). Anyway, the upshot is that there is no problem with any Doloreaux character being a firm supporter of Lutara, but it's probably not a smart move to be too vocal about it, both because of the accusations of heresy, and because the religion itself is secretive. Any questions, or if you want to discuss this, or have another interpretation, feel free to page me or mail me. We're trying to stick with the cannon information here as much as possible. Cheers, Az\\""

"Apr 18 09:07 StoryHost Azrael, \\"New round of promotions. I've paged everyone telling them to find sponsors (or to put in more favors/disfavors) and reset their favor to 0 if they are in line for a promotion - I've also updated the +currfavor command. If you use +currfavor it will say how much favor they have like before, but it will also tell you how many favors they've filed, and the ratio of favor to disfavor. If their ratio is more than 0.75 or less than 0.25 then they will need to balance it more before they can get their promotion. There will also be a note telling us if they can be promoted, or telling us that they are in line to be promoted if they meet certain conditions, and a note about what those conditions are. (for example, +currfavor caliste and you'll see that she's very out of balance from too many favors and not many disfavors, and you'll see a note saying she can be promoted if she gets it into balance)\\""

"Apr 18 09:09 StoryHost Azrael, \\"Oh, and if someone gets a sponsor, you can promote them then delete the trait:favor:promotion property so it no longer says they can be promoted in +currfavor. "Jul 23 22:48 StoryHost Azrael, \\"Hey guys, a change to game policy, for anyone that deals with player complaints. Previously, if you deal with a player and they're not happy they could escalate the problem to the area lead (lead plotter, lead guide etc.) and if still unhappy they could escalate it to the game host, and if still unhappy, they can escalate it to Skotos CE. CE tells me that they don't want to be in a position to second-guess the host, since we know what's going on in the game, and they don't. So they've asked that we change the policy. Now the escalation goes staffer -\> lead -\> host. With the host being the end of the line. If they don't like my decision, they can suck an egg. Unless their complaint is about a legal issue, or something that needs immediate action without discussion, any emails to CE will be forwarded to me. CE is still the right place for them to go if they have account or payment issues. Cheers!\\""

"Dec 9 17:36 StoryPlotter Sirazad, \\"In regards of STP refunds and item transfers when characters are deleted etc. We didn't exactly have a clear precedent on this and at times we have been slightly fractual, however the guidelines are as follows and we should apply them consequently: we do not refund and we do not allow to transfer items from char A to char B upon the deleting of char A of the same player (eg I delete my pirate and I give the pistol to my new alt who is a bisclavret gentry). The only time we allow refund or item transfer of this sort is if the deleting of the char and making of the new one is based on staff suggestion, and is based on OOC reasons. Thank you everyone for the understanding.\\""

"Dec 10 05:35 StoryPlotter Sirazad, \\"In regards of giving over guild and house leadership. I realised we are following a non-consequent precedent here too. The institute of the vote is for VP guilds only. If someone is in a guild, and the leader goes inactive, we do not give the guild over to someone else. That is the major difference between houses and guilds. Houses belong to the house and the PC leading it only represents the house. And if you dislike it, you can not go and just make a new house. However guilds belong to the PCs who own them. So if they want to sell it, give it away or desert it? They can. We should not interfere with it. Especially as anyone in the guild can make a new guild easily and start their very own business. So when people ask for being set as owner, it should always be the owner filing that request. We have made a few exceptions when the leader left via ooc reasons (ban etc), but we should mostly keep this distinction. Thank you for your attention.\\""

"Apr 5 04:17 StoryCoder Azrael, \\"Hi guys. I've coded a VERY simple poisoning system. Check out Ironclaw:Lib:Poisons and you'll find an eyedropper. You can use that to \\"poison \ with my eyedropper\\" to poison things. First you'll need to fill it with a poison, though - so you'll need the poison jar (same directory) - and \\"refill my eyedropper from poison jar\\" - and finally, in PoisonsLib is the code for what the poison will do when someone tastes it. Right now this doesn't take into account player skill in poisoning, but when I get a chance I'll add that. The example poison is the gender change cake poison (so if we want to extend that plot, we could use this to allow PCs to poison new types of food) - I'll try to get a chance soon to code in player skills for poisoning, make a few new types of poisons, and set up a quest so assassins can get their hands on a few jars of poison.\\""

"Jul 20 01:57 StoryCoder Azrael, \\"New command, +autoreturn. Use it on \\"normal\\" items that might be lying around in the gameworld. It will make them return to their current location after a delay. So for example, if you put a broom in a broom closet, you could set it to autoreturn after 20 hours. This way you don't need to worry about one player \\"stealing\\" the broom and it not being available for anyone else. Future plans involve: being able to put a message (such as a servant replacing the broom) and possibly a message for the person who had the broom so they don't wonder where it went. As well as returning the item, you can also set it to replace the item (so whoever took the broom can keep it, and a new broom will appear in the broom closet. Useful for \\"common\\" items that shouldn't be hard to get your hands on.\\""

"Nov 20 20:28 StoryCoder Azrael, \\"Promotion code will now be run automatically, and weekly. Every week the code will check for who deserves a promotion, demotion, or demotion warning, and set properties \& send out pages as appropriate. We still need to read the favor tas list, and put in the favor \& rumors, but as long as those are kept up to date, the promotions \& demotions will be given automatically. I've also made some (minor) tweaks to how it's calculated. Now it requires current rank + 7 to go up a level (so higher ranks need more favor) and if you go below -10 favor, you get warned that you're at risk of demotion. Then you have a month where you're \\"safe\\" and after that month if your favor goes below -20 you get demoted. (If you can get your favor back to 0 or above, the warning goes away. And next time you drop to -10 you get a new warning, and a new month of safety. This means that PCs can do that \\"big thing\\" that gets them lots of disfavor, without getting demoted. As long as they then make an effort to gain favor again afterwards.\\""

"Nov 17 13:23 StoryGuide Astrea, \\"On the Southern vs Old issue, I checked the old Rin VPs created by Az and co back in the day. All the nobles have Old as their main language and most don't even know or only barely know Southern. So it's certainly been established over the years, by former staffers, that Old is the language of the Rinaldi nobles, and not Southern. From a historical point of view, this makes sense. The Rinaldi were the first on Calabria and would have brought Old with them back in the day. So it'd make sense they still speak it. Southern on the other hand -can- be a regional dialect/language coming from old that the peasants and commoners would use among themselves, especially those removed from Triskellian and the Rinaldi nobles. Which would also explain why the Rin nobles doesn't speak Southern, as why should they bother learn the bastardized language of the rabble. Just a few observations seeing there's the discussion on the forums currently about Old vs Southern. I personally never have heard that Rin nobles should speak Southern, but rather that they'd always speak Old if they're to be considered being anything, and from what I recall, it's also what VPs like Mercutio would speak when speaking to peers.\\""

"Apr 16 13:09 StoryPlotter Eos, \\"I suddenly realized that our crafting is rather imbalanced when it comes to raw-materials. Clothing careers have something like 12-14 different types of cloth that can be bought IG via NPCs, while carpenter, jewellery and metal/armour/weapon workers only have a few. This may be a reason why so many crafts are suffering. If we expand what raw-materials the other crafts have access to (even if it may be a bit difficult to think of enough things), and leave the more fancy things to the house imports (like we're already doing with cloth), then we might see some better guild-competition IC. We have plenty of clothiers, and even some competing guilds (Meepers, Brie, Carolyn on the top of my head), but carpentry only has the Bisc house, jewellery is Clover because it's impossible to get anything even slightly nice or gems to make stuff from, I think weapon/armour are doing a bit better, but not that much. Something to think about. What do you say?\\""

"Feb 13 01:41 StoryPlotter Spot, \\"Promotion tokens have been issued to each of the Houses based on the active members in the House itself (but not in the subguilds like the Trade Union). Thus the Avoir and Dolo got 6 each, the Bisc got 9, and the Rinaldi got 12.. We need to speak to the leadership of the Houses OOC to lay out the expectations their own superiors have for how the 'land is distributed'. Specifically, the tokens and promotions are supposed to be spread out over as many PCs as possible and ideally saved rather than spent at once. That means we will absolutely not be allowing 3 or more tokens to be spent on a single character. Single tokens are recommended for anyone who has been a member for \< 4 months, or has been promoted within the last 4 months or so. 2 tokens will be the most we'll be allowing, and then only for well established chars in the House who haven't received any promotions for a while. This is at least my proposal. I'm happy to be overruled, particularly by our leads (Eos, Bast, Death, Az) if it seems too much of a burden.\\""

"Jun 26 01:21 StoryCoder Azrael, \\"Khagra/Aluine - yeah, my kneejerk reaction is to assume it's alt interaction if Khagra hands the guild to an alt. If Khagra handed the guild to a different player, who then (free from influence from Khagra) decided to hand it to Aluine - then that's OK (as long as we don't feel that it was motivated OOCly by the player) - i.e. if Aluine got a guild from \\"someone else\\" it's fine. If Aluine got the guild from Khagra, even if Khagra passed it via another player, then it's not fine. So my feelings are the same as Nyx, sounds like at the very least it should be taken away, depending on how many other active PCs are in the guild.\\""
